Articles.Content:
So I've been working on this concept for a while and came up with this.

Twice the size of the launch tower, and KSPcalc says over 170 tons loaded I have no idea what the maximum payload capacity of this thing is.

Nothing special as far as mods, Sunday Punch's and NovaSilisko's packs with a and a dash of the_bT's radial stack decoupler.
Nice. Thats an awesome rocket. Using radial stack decouplers to make liquid fuel boosters is really fun. Look what i made

Nice.

Don't know what this post is supposed to represent

The design was originally meant to provide heavy lifting capacity without relying on insane groups of solid rocket boosters, I have since added SRBs to increase lifting capacity and fuel efficiancy on the first stage, that said the 8 SRBs around the first stage are entirely optional and the rocket will launch without them.

As far as a flight manual to those who want to attempt to fly this thing just know that if you are using the SRBs, Do not launch with more then 40% throttle.
I thought your rocket design was cool. I edited my first post to represent that.

So I noticed that I constructed that rocket out of parts that are no longer in the newer versions of the parts pack, ergo I present the UHLV IIb Mod 2:

Mostly the same rocket, just added the vernier thrusters to assist with aiming this beast.

Uses Sunday Punch's and NovaSilisko's packs with a dash of the_bT's radial stack decoupler with Corona688's tuned SAS kits as a garnish.

Note: Due to Sunday punch deciding to double the capacity and weight of the 3m fuel tanks used in this, the rocket no longer works.
